meanings.sent1: The tree in our backyard is very branchy.
meanings.sent2: The bush looked branchy with its many twigs.
meanings.sent3: The branchy shrub seemed to wave at me in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, all branchy and tangled, was a mess after the hike.
meanings.sent5: The branchy silhouette of the tree against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Resembling a branch in form or structure.
meanings.sent1: The coral reef had a branchy appearance underwater.
meanings.sent2: The lightning struck the tree, leaving a branchy scar.
meanings.sent3: The branchy pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her veins looked branchy, like tiny rivers under her skin.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a branchy design on the vase, mimicking nature.
